The giant senator rubbed her bare midriff and walked over to the building. Once there, she crouched down and looked through the windows. So much so that she found her mouth watering, letting gallons of saliva drip to the concrete ground. Surprisingly, no one inside of the building took notice of her presence, until one female employee decided to look up at the windows and gave the expected response to seeing a seventy-foot tall giant woman.

All of the other factory workers gazed at the direction in which the female was pointing her shaking right finger at. And they all had a similar reaction.

Yet another exclaimed. “We all need to get the hell out of here!”

Others fell onto their knees, clasped their hands together, and were pleading with Padme to not eat, or crush them. A few scrambled into the automobiles lying motionless in the parking lots and frantically drove off into the distance, some of them even causing some damages to the vehicles and gate on their way out of the vicinity. All that the humanoid extraterrestrial could do in response to all of this madness was to raise her left eyebrow in confusion.

“Hmmm. These miniscule creatures are acting very peculiar for some reason.” She said to herself, her facial expression morphing into a depressed one. “I am a nice girl. I do not intend to harm anyone on this planet. Why can no one here just see that?”

The boy, no older than seventeen, was stunned by how the giantess was speaking to him. “M-M-My name is Kal, Kal Shepard.” He quickly stammered out. “I work here. This is a soda factory, for Pepsi.”

Padme tilted her head to the right, puzzled. “’Pepsi’? What’s that?”

The General of the army face palmed at her failed assault on the giantess. “Well, that did not work.” Then, she turned to her soldiers. “So, does anyone here have any other ideas? I am open to any suggestion that is not stupid.”

One of them raised their right hand. “We could grab a bunch of food and use it to lure her away from the city.”

General Carla Martinez simply gave her a momentary stare before replying. “Anyone else?”

“Wait, here me out, sir.” The soldier, Abby Kruger, insisted. “The food can act as bait and when the giant is out of New York, then we can hit her again, but with stronger weapons. This way no citizens will get hurt.” She explained. “We should at least give it a shot, right?”

Carla paused for a moment, scowling at the dire situation that they were in. She still thought that the plan was absolutely insane, but with a lack of other options, there was not much of a choice. “Very well then, we will attempt this little ploy of yours.” She contacted the mayor and instructed him to have every remaining building with food hand all of their edible material over to the army.

Near the destroyed Pepsi factory, Padme was enjoying her fun time with the little boy in her hands. For the past hour, she had been subjecting him to a tortuous display of kisses, hugs, and tickles. For the first time since she landed on this strange little blue planet, the white-clad giantess felt like she was having fun. Kal was given a break from his treatment and wanted to say something to the giant woman. “So, Miss…”

“Padme Amidala, Senator of Naboo.” She replied.

“And what would that be?” Kal asked.

“It is a planet in another solar system in a galaxy far, far away from this one.” Padme explained. “It is a part of the Galactic Republic, a galaxy-spanning coalition of planets dedicated to maintaining. Peace and order.”

This was a lot for a mere soda factory employee to comprehend. “How did you get to Planet Earth?”

“I landed in a small forest a short walk from here,” She stated. “Well, short for me, at least. I could take you there sometime, if you want.” The woman added with a wink.

The ginger’s face once again matched the shade of his hair and shirt as that statement even further bewildered him. A seventy-foot tall female – and a rather attractive one, in his personal opinion – had essentially invited him to travel with her on an inter-galactic journey to a possibly advanced extra-terrestrial civilization. It was almost unimaginable.

“Padme, I-I-I don’t know what to say.”

But before Kal could take her up on the offer, Padme’s nose caught wind of a tantalizing scent. She could not quite identify what it was, but the smell was so appealing that she found herself walking over to its source while carrying Kal with her.

After thirty minutes of walking, Padme had come across a jaw-dropping sight. Standing before on the outskirts of the city was a twenty-five-foot tall mountain of various foodstuffs that were foreign to her, though Kal could tell what they were. There were burgers, fries, pizzas, hotdogs, sodas, cakes, doughnuts, pies, ice cream, and sandwiches. Overtaken by her aptly massive appetite, Padme let Kal down gently and began gorging on the mound. With seemingly no one watching her with the exception of her new friend, Padme, felt like throwing her manners out the window. She shoveled down literal tons of the unhealthy material, relishing the opportunity to savor the flavor of these new local Earth delicacies. The only pauses that she made were when she had to let out boisterous belches, blushing and awkwardly excusing herself afterward. In only a few minutes, the pile of food had been completely demolished, leaving just the super stuffed senator laying on the grass and rubbing her packed paunch. On occasion, she would belt out another atrocious eructation, this time giggling like a child after finding it to be amusing in an immature sort of way. Kal, having watched the whole thing, went slack-jawed, a sight that Padme found hilarious.

“Hehehe. I bet you were not -*BUURPPPPP!* excuse me - expecting that.” She said with a smug smirk.

Kal nodded his head in response. “Do you want a belly rub?”

Padme nodded back and Kal approached her, pressing his comparatively small hand into her tummy and messaged it. Padme moaned in delight before the motions pushed out some more gas. “*BBHHHHRRAAAAAAAAP!* Please pardon me, Kal. I should try to be more ladylike.” She apologized, though her tone implied that she thought he was enjoying it.

Kale merely blushed again and kept on rubbing. Meanwhile, the army was watching the two, wondering if they should commence there assault on the destructive, but well-meaning giantess.
